intro: Arenaria macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions. Arenaria macrocalyx thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
